definition: (of a device, e.g. public telephone, ticket inspection machine) designed to have a card or ticket inserted
to insert/stick in/pierce/to take part in/to interfere/to interpose
to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette

sentences.english: Temperature control module is plug-in card designed, easy to use and maintain .
sentences.chinese: 溫控模塊採用插卡式設計，維修方便快捷，易於操作。

sentences.english: Temperature control by card avoids adjustment by others.
sentences.chinese: 插卡式溫度控制防止其他人調校。

sentences.english: Plug-in card temperature control, to prevent arbitrary changing welding temperature.
sentences.chinese: 插卡式溫度控制，防止隨意改動焊接溫度。

sentences.english: Plug-in temperature control, responding to prevent random changes welding temperature.
sentences.chinese: 插卡式溫度控制，防止隨意改動焊接溫度。

definition: (of a device) designed to accept a cassette, cartridge or canister (loanword from "cassette")/designed to have a card or ticket inserted (also written 插卡式[cha1 ka3 shi4]) (loanword from "card")
(of a magnet) to attract metallic objects/(fig.) to exert a magnetic attraction (for investment, tourists etc)
set-top box/decoder for digital or satellite TV signal etc
